name: NPR
text: Jimmy Heath, who died in January at 93, may or may not have conceived "Love Letter" as a parting gift, but it carries a sense of proud accomplishment ‚Äî the feeling of an acknowledged master taking a stately and well-deserved victory lap.  https://t.co/UNpyi6xJgq

name: NPR
text:
Despite increases in coronavirus cases in nearly half the country, sports leagues are moving ahead with plans to reopen.

Here's a breakdown of what the NFL, WNBA, MLB and others are planning.
https://t.co/QSGPxOOUVS

name: NPR
text:
NEW: President Trump will formally accept the GOP nomination in late August in Jacksonville, Fla., not Charlotte, N.C., following a dispute between him and North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper over coronavirus safety precautions.
https://t.co/D1Ewomb10T

name: NPR
text:
The Louisville Metro Council has voted unanimously to ban no-knock warrants, naming the measure after Breonna Taylor, who was killed by police in her home during a raid in March.
https://t.co/uk0DO872YP

name: NPR
text:
The EPA has ordered Amazon and eBay to stop selling unregistered products for coronavirus. In one case, the agency said eBay marketed and sold 55-gallon drums of methylene chloride as a coronavirus disinfectant. 

Exposure to the chemical can cause death.
https://t.co/1t9wnY4tFY

name: NPR
text:
The term "outside agitator" has been used throughout America's history of protest; notably, it was used to dismiss civil rights leaders like Martin Luther King Jr. 

But what does it really mean?

The latest from @NPRCodeSwitch: https://t.co/CjSZovSMQx

name: NPR
text:
Protests have erupted in New Zealand over the killing of George Floyd as the indigenous Maori people push back against police use of force ‚Äî which disproportionately affects them.
https://t.co/tlX84ciG0f

name: NPR
text: The Los Angeles Police Department has reassigned seven officers to non-field duties while it investigates dozens of complaints of excessive force during the recent protests in the city.  https://t.co/cnjFJgosH8

name: NPR
text:
The framers of the U.S. Constitution left vague the powers of the executive branch.

Here's a look at how the office of the presidency became more powerful than anything the Founding Fathers imagined possible. (@throughlineNPR)
https://t.co/YL66QICM8R

name: NPR
text:
GOP Rep. Denver Riggleman of Virginia agreed to officiate a same-sex wedding last July.

The move sparked backlash among Republicans ‚Äî and a primary challenge that may cost Riggleman his seat.

"He's out of step on marriage," his challenger said.
https://t.co/ralGA9kXLz

name: NPR
text:
When Democratic legislators donned kente cloth at the unveiling of legislation aimed at police brutality, critics weighed in. 

Here's a look at the history and symbolism of kente cloth  ‚Äî and the controversy.
https://t.co/TXq5mvld9q

name: NPR
text: Spike Lee‚Äôs ‚ÄòDa 5 Bloods‚Äô is a loving throwback to the Hollywood war movies of yesteryear ‚Äî but also a timely critique of the U.S.' long, shameful history of devaluing its black soldiers. https://t.co/qWggRHEbNt

name: NPR
text: This connection between doctor and patient is what medicine is all about, a Chicago psychiatrist says ‚Äî and it‚Äôs also what she misses most about not seeing her patients in-person. (@WBEZ) https://t.co/0PVxZimu3u

name: NPR
text:
After facing extinction in the late 19th century, otters are making a comeback in the eastern North Pacific. 

While their return can restore ecosystems and boost tourism ‚Äî hungry otters can also threaten the food security of indigenous communities.
https://t.co/rRbFL1G40d

name: NPR
text:
Zaina Arafat's "You Exist Too Much" follows a woman trapped in the space between different cultures and religions, navigating both her sexual identity and the fear of rejection. 

Arafat does a lot in her debut novel, our critic writes ‚Äî and it works. https://t.co/Zg2NYSRaZy

name: NPR
text:
Norah Jones has been consistently making music on her own and with countless other artists since her smash debut in 2002. 

With the release of her 7th studio album, ‚ÄúPick Me Off the Floor,‚Äù Jones says she‚Äôs more creatively inspired now than ever. https://t.co/SqhZlxjEeE

name: NPR
text:
Singer-songwriter Georgia Anne Muldrow gravitates to jazz bassist and composer Charles Mingus' example as a creative maverick, a political activist and an outspoken advocate for black America. Listen here üéß
